meanings.definition: Marked by careful thinking or consideration.
examples: Air pollution is a serious matter.

images.alt: Photo of a woman with her hand to her face.
images.description: A woman looks at the viewer. She is not smiling. She has her hand up at the side of her cheek.
images.caption: This person looks like she is thinking carefully about something serious.

examples: Air pollution can cause egregous harm.

images.alt: Photo of a woman with her hand to her face.
images.description: A woman looks at the viewer. She is not smiling. She has her hand up at the side of her cheek.
images.caption: This person looks like she is thinking carefully about something serious.

meanings.definition: A statement that harm or punishment will follow.
examples: Our neighbor uses threats to frighten intruders away from his property.

images.alt: Photo of a 'No Trespassing' sign on a fence.
images.description: A 'No Trespassing' sign on a fence. The sign says that violators will be prosecuted.
images.caption: This sign has the threat that if someone trespasses onto this property, they will be prosecuted.

meanings.definition: A chance that harm or punishment will follow.
examples: Our neighbor makes people feel in peril by yelling whenever anyone comes near his fence.

images.alt: Photo of a 'No Trespassing' sign on a fence.
images.description: A 'No Trespassing' sign on a fence. The sign says that violators will be prosecuted.
images.caption: This sign suggests that people will be in peril of prosecution if they trespass on the property.

meanings.definition: The location of a person or thing.
examples: The control tower asked the pilot to give the position of his airplane.

images.alt: Photo of a chess board with chess pieces.
images.description: People playing chess. Black and white pieces are on the board. The board is on a table and one person sits on either side of the table.
images.caption: Knowing the position of each chess piece is important for deciding your next move.

meanings.definition: The location of a person or thing.
examples: The control tower asked the pilot to give the stance, or position, of his airplane.

images.alt: Photo of a chess board with chess pieces.
images.description: People playing chess. Black and white pieces are on the board. The board is on a table and one person sits on either side of the table.
images.caption: Knowing the stance of each chess player toward how to play the game is important for deciding your strategy.

meanings.definition: Made reasonable or excusable by demonstrated facts; warranted
examples: We do not think your anger is justified.

meanings.definition: Made reasonable or excusable by demonstrated facts; warranted
examples: We do not think your anger is justified.

meanings.definition: To carry out or do something, especially something like a mistake or a crime.
examples: She committed a crime when she drove a car while under the influence of alcohol.

meanings.definition: To carry out or do something, especially something like a mistake or a crime.
examples: She perpetrated a crime when she drove a car while under the influence of alcohol.
Advocates of the death penalty say that the threat of being punished by death stops people from committing violent crimes.

images.alt: Photo of a group of people.
images.description: A large group of people gathered on a street, holding signs.
images.caption: Advocates of a cause gather together to make their voice heard.

examples: Those who take the contrary position argue that the death penalty does not lower rates of violent crime.
Swimming at the beach is often prohibited when there is no lifeguard on duty.

images.alt: A sign on a fence listing activities not allowed.
images.description: A sign on a fence says, No Skateboarding, No Bicycle Riding, No Rollerblading, No Scooter Riding.

meanings.definition: To let go; to set free.
examples: Anthony Ray Hinton was released from prison after spending 30 years on death row.

images.alt: Photo of a person releasing a bird
images.description: A person stands with hands in the air, having just let a large bird fly away. The bird is flying just above the person, wings extended.
images.caption: The bird is free now that it has been released back to nature.

source.title: eagle release belle isle state park
source.author: vastateparksstaff

examples: After further investigation, the convicted felonâ€™s guilty verdict was reversed, and he was released from prison.

images.alt: Drawing of a yin yang symbol
images.description: A circle with a curved white shape on one side and a curved black shape on the other. The shapes are exactly the same, but opposite in color and are reversed horizontally, too.
images.caption: Each side of this symbol is the reverse of the other
